олово (химия); дарить; для придания; наградить; Тайвань пр. [xi2]

heisig_chinese_memo: Tin is soft, bends easily, and melts at a low temperature. Hence tin is written as the metal that is easy to work with.
Ru_trainchinese:
xī: (сущ) олово (Sn)
xī: (графема) (книжн.) даровать, жаловать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: it's easy (易) for gold (金) to get tin
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Tin foil might be the easiest and cheapest metal to get ahold of.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Tin " changes from " Gold ", " Yi ", or erroneously to "昜", the original meaning is a metal name.

Jinwen expresses a reward. Bronze rewards are all referred to as " yi ", but also as " gai " and " given ". Yi Dang is the original word for tin and so on. "Poetry" and "Book" are both " tin " and no " given ", so the inscription " Yi " is usually named " tin ". Rusheng Shigui: "Chu Baixi, use Zhabaogui", Guo Jizi's white plate: "Tianwei rides on horse", Zeng Bozhen: "Blessing of Tianwei", "Poetry. "Jian Xi": "Gong Yan Xi Jue", "Shang Shu•Hong Fan": "Tian Xi Yu Hong Fan Jiu Fan".

" Tin " is also a metal. It is one of the main raw materials for smelting chain bronze. "Shuowen": "Silver and lead also change from gold to sound." Same as "钖", see "钖". The word " tin " is also added from the word " head ", such as Zeng Boyan: "Golden Road and Tin", " Gold " and " Tin " in dialogue, meaning metal; the whole sentence means the way of making tribute or trading with gold and tin (Guo Moruo).
humanum_short_description_en: " Tin " changes from " Gold ", " Yi ", or erroneously to "昜", the original meaning is a metal name.
humanum_full_description:
「錫」從「金」，「易」聲，或訛變為從「昜」，本義是一種金屬名。

　　金文表示賞賜。金文賞賜皆作「易」，亦作「睗」、「賜」。易當為錫等的本字。《詩》、《書》皆作「錫」而無「賜」，故金文「易」多隸定為「錫」。如生史簋：「楚白錫□，用乍寶簋」，虢季子白盤：「天睗乘馬」，曾伯簠：「天睗之福」，《詩．簡兮》：「公言錫爵」，《尚書•洪範》：「天錫禹洪範九範」。

　　「錫」又是金屬，為冶鍊青銅的主要原料之一，《說文》：「銀鉛之間也，從金，易聲」，與「鍚」同，參見「鍚」。「錫」字亦有加從「目」者，如曾伯簠：「金道錫行」，「金」、「錫」對言，意指金屬；全句意謂以金錫入貢或交易之路（郭沫若）。
humanum_short_description: 「錫」從「金」，「易」聲，或訛變為從「昜」，本義是一種金屬名。

「 錫 」從「 金 」，「 易 」聲，或訛變為從「 昜 」，本義是一種金屬名。 金文表示賞賜。金文賞賜皆作「 易 」，亦作「 睗 」、「 賜 」。易當為錫等的本字。《詩》、《書》皆作「 錫 」而無「 賜 」，故金文「 易 」多隸定為「 錫 」。如生史簋：「楚白錫□，用乍寶簋」，虢季子白盤：「天睗乘馬」，曾伯簠：「天睗之福」，《詩．簡兮》：「公言錫爵」，《尚書•洪範》：「天錫禹洪範九範」。 「 錫 」又是金屬，為冶鍊青銅的主要原料之一，《說文》：「銀鉛之間也，從金，易聲」，與「 鍚 」同，參見「 鍚 」。「 錫 」字亦有加從「 目 」者，如曾伯簠：「金道錫行」，「 金 」、「 錫 」對言，意指金屬；全句意謂以金錫入貢或交易之路（郭沫若）。
" Tin" changes from " Gold", " Yi", or erroneously to " 昜", the original meaning is a metal name. Jinwen expresses a reward. Bronze rewards are all referred to as " yi", but also as " gai" and " given". Yi Dang is the original word for tin and so on. "Poetry" and "Book" are both " tin" and no " given", so the inscription " Yi" is usually named " tin". Rusheng Shigui: "Chu Baixi, use Zhabaogui", Guo Jizi's white plate: "Tianwei rides on horse", Zeng Bozhen: "Blessing of Tianwei", "Poetry. "Jian Xi": "Gong Yan Xi Jue", "Shang Shu•Hong Fan": "Tian Xi Yu Hong Fan Jiu Fan". " Tin" is also a metal. It is one of the main raw materials for smelting chain bronze. "Shuowen": "Silver and lead also change from gold to sound." Same as " 钖", see " 钖". The word " tin" is also added from the word " head", such as Zeng Boyan: "Golden Road and Tin", " Gold" and " Tin" in dialogue, meaning metal; the whole sentence means the way of making tribute or trading with gold and tin (Guo Moruo).

錫字的基本解释

錫
xī
见“锡”。

錫字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xī］
［《廣韻》先擊切，入錫，心。］
“锡1”的繁体字。
(1)金属元素。符号Sn。银白色，富有延展性，在空气中不易起变化。
(2)指锡杖。
(3)赐予。
(4)指贡给。
(5)赐予恩宠或财物。
(6)指江苏无锡的锡山。
(7)用作无锡市的简称。
(8)通“緆”。细布。
(9)介词。与，对。
(10)姓。东汉有锡光。见《後汉书·岑彭传》。
[②]［tì］
［《集韻》他歷切，入錫，透。］
“锡2”的繁体字。通“鬄1”。
假发。

錫字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　錫； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1312第05
〔古文〕㒪【唐韻】先擊切【集韻】【韻會】先的切，?音裼。【說文】銀鉛之閒。从金易聲。【徐曰】銀色而鉛質也。【詩·衞風】如金如錫。【傳】金錫鍊而精。【爾雅·釋器】錫謂之鈏。【疏】錫，金白鑞也。一名鈏。　又【博雅】赤銅謂之錫。　又【爾雅·釋詁】賜也。【易·師卦】王三錫命。【書·堯典】師錫帝曰。【傳】錫，與也。【左傳·莊元年】王使榮叔來錫桓公命。【註】錫，賜也。【禮·緯文】九錫，一曰輿馬、二曰衣服、三曰樂器、四曰朱戸、五曰納陛、六曰虎賁、七曰弓矢、八曰鈇鉞、九曰秬鬯。　又粉錫，胡粉也。　又姓。【吳志】漢末有錫光。　又地名。【左傳·文十一年】楚伐麇，至於錫穴。【前漢·功臣表】無錫侯多軍。　又【集韻】斯義切，音瀃。予也。本作賜。　又【五音集韻】思積切，音昔。細布也。【禮·雜記】加灰錫也。【註】取緦以爲布，又加灰治之，則曰錫，言錫然滑易也。【儀禮·大射儀】冪用錫若絺。【註】錫，細布也。【疏】謂之錫者，治其布，使之滑易也。【史記·司馬相如傳】被阿錫。【註】錫

暂无。

tin
Basic explanation of words
tin
xī
See "tin".
tin
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xī］
["Guangyun" first strikes and cuts, enters the tin, and the heart. ]
Traditional characters for "锡1".
(1) Metal elements. Symbol Sn. Silver white, full of malleability, not easy to change in the air.
(2) Refers to the tin rod.
(3) Grant.
(4) Refers to tribute.
(5) Give grace or property.
(6) Refers to Xishan in Wuxi, Jiangsu.
(7) Used as the abbreviation of Wuxi City.
(8) Through "緆". Muslin.
(9) Prepositions. And, yes.
(10) Last name. There was tin light in the Eastern Han Dynasty. See "Book of Later Han Cen Peng Biography".
[②]［tì］
["Ji Yun" he cuts into the tin, and penetrates. ]
Traditional characters for "锡2". Same as "鬄1".
wig.
tin
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 Tin; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1312 No. 05
〔古文〕㒪【Tang Yun】cut first 【Jiyun】【Rhyme will】cut first,? Sound. [Said the text] The leisure of silver and lead. From Jin Yisheng. [Xu Yue] Silver and lead. 【Poetry·Weifeng】like gold like tin. 【Biography】Golden tin chain and fine. [Erya·Release Device] Tin is called 鈏. [Sparse] Tin, gold and white pewter also. One 鈏.　[Bo Ya] Red copper is called tin.　[Erya·Shixu] Give me too. [Yi·Shi Gua] Wang Sanxi's life. [Book·Yaodian] Said Emperor Shixi. [Biography] Tin, and also. [Zuo Zhuan·The first year of Zhuang] Wang Shi Rongshu came to Xihuan for the appointment. [Note] Tin, give it too. 【Rite·Weiwen】Nine tins, one is horse, second is clothes, third is musical instrument, fourth is Zhu Shi, fifth is Nabi, six is tiger ben, seven is bow and arrow, eight is 鈇yue, and nine is 秬鬯.　Fen Tin, Hu Fen.　Another last name. [Wu Zhi] There was tin light in the late Han Dynasty.　Also place name. [Zuo Zhuan·Wen eleventh year] Chu defeated Nian, as for the Xixue. [Former Han · Hero Form] Wuxi Hou Duojun.　[Jiyun] Siyiqie, Yinyang. I also. This is a gift.　[Five-tone Jiyun] Thinking and cutting, sound Xi. Fine cloth too. 【Ritual·Miscellaneous】Gray tin is also added. [Note] If you take 缌 for cloth and add ash to cure it, it is called tin, and it is easy to say that the tin is smooth. 【Ritual·Large Shooting Instrument】The power uses Xiruoyun. [Note] Tin, fine cloth also. 【Sparse】Those who are called tin, cure their cloth and make it slippery. 【Historical Records · Sima Xiangru Biography】Beed by Axi. [Note] Tin
